definition: may be done once and once only/just this once

definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
(negative prefix)/not/no
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to exceed all expectations/to come as a surprise
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
quick fix/opportune short cut (around a difficulty)/cheap trick (to get what one wants)/to pull a fast one
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
to win by a surprise move
to seek life in death (idiom); to fight for one's life
to speculate/to ponder
extremely difficult
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
variant of 魯莽|鲁莽[lu3 mang3]
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected

unheard-of/unprecedented
